mechanoreception.notes: As sponges, Craticulariidae likely possess basic mechanoreception for detecting water currents and physical disturbances. This is inferred based on the general biology of sponges.

chemoreception.notes: Sponges rely on chemoreception to detect food particles and other chemical cues in the water. This is inferred based on the general biology of sponges.

photoreception.notes: Photoreception in this family is unknown. Sponges are generally considered to lack specialized photoreceptors, but some species may have light-sensitive cells.
